metadata.title: CVE-2023-31085 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in drivers/mtd/ubi/cdev.c in the Linux kernel 6.2.There is a divide-by-zero error in do_div(sz,mtd->erasesize), usedindirectly by ctrl_cdev_ioctl, when mtd->erasesize is 0.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-31085` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-1118-fips - 4.15.0-1118.129
linux-image-hmac-4.15.0-1118-fips - 4.15.0-1118.129
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1118-fips - 4.15.0-1118.129
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.15.0-1118-fips - 4.15.0-1118.129
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-2102-aws-fips - 4.15.0-2102.108
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.15.0-2102-aws-fips - 4.15.0-2102.108
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-2081-azure-fips - 4.15.0-2081.87
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.15.0-2081-azure-fips - 4.15.0-2081.87
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-2065-gcp-fips - 4.15.0-2065.70
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.15.0-2065-gcp-fips - 4.15.0-2065.70
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro
